body_html: I've been looking at this on and off and I can't seem to figure out where the problem is. All the method does is create a new array object with the type of the original torch tensor and passes it on to numpy astype. But I did also find that if I used x = torch.IntTensor([1, -2, 3, -4]) , it also passes. I also changed to using numpy 1.13.3 but that did not help. When I try to add casting='safe' to the astype I get an error that the casting is not safe going from float to uint8. Unfortunately I do not have an x86 system to experiment.

body: I've been looking at this on and off and I can't seem to figure out where the problem is.  All the method does is create a new array object with the type of the original torch tensor and passes it on to numpy astype.  But I did also find that if I used x = torch.IntTensor([1, -2, 3, -4]) , it also passes.   I also changed to using numpy 1.13.3 but that did not help.  When I try to add casting='safe' to the astype I get an error that the casting is not safe going from float to uint8.   Unfortunately I do not have an x86 system to experiment.
